description: Numbers n such that binary expansion does not begin 11.
formula: a(0)=1, a(1)=1 and for k>0: a(k*2)=a(k*2-1)+1, a(k*2+1)=a(k+1)*2. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 09 2002For n>0, a(n) = 1/2 * (4n - 3 - A006257(n-1)). - _Ralf Stephan_, Sep 16 2003
crossrefs: Apart from initial terms, same as A004754.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
